comics.alt: You could at least not wear the lab coat everywhere, dude.
comics.title: Bill Nye

comics.alt: Cue angry letters from all seven fans of Xenocide.
comics.title: Nighttime Stories

comics.transcript:
[[Boy is looking through box]]
Boy: Hey, my old Star Wars books!
[[holding a pair of books and showing them to Girl]]
Boy: Man. Timothy Zahn, Michael A. Stackpole, The Corellian Trilogy...
Boy: This was my world.
Girl: What'd you leave it for? Firefly? BSG?
Boy: Nah.
Boy: I guess I've just grown out of the whole obsessive fan mindset.
Girl: Really.
Girl: So how's Ron Paul doing?
Boy: Ooh! Lemme recheck today's blogs.
[[Boy heads off]]
{{title text: Ron Paul wants to put the New Republic back on the Corusca gem standard.}}
comics.alt: Ron Paul wants to put the New Republic back on the Corusca gem standard.
comics.title: Fandom

comics.alt: "But there are seven billion people in the world! I can't possibly stop to consider how ALL of them might interpret something!" "Ah, yes, there's no middle ground between 'taking personal responsibility for the thoughts and feelings of every single person on Earth' and 'covering your eyes and ears and yelling logically correct statements into the void.' That's a very insightful point and not at all inane."
comics.title: Misinterpretation

comics.alt: "It's a little low for a weather balloon; it might be some other kind." "Yeah. Besides, I know I'm the alien conspiracy guy, but come on--the idea that the government would care about hiding something so mundane as atmospheric temperature measurement is too ridiculous even for me."
comics.title: Ufo

comics.transcript:
[[BERET GUY stands in a doorway into a dark room, silhouetted against the light]]
Beret: I came here to chew bubblegum and make friends!

[[Now in a well lit space, BERET GUY stands silently, facing two figures.]]

[[BERET GUY stretches out a hand towards the figures, who completely fail to react.]]
Beret: Want some gum?

{{Title text: I came here to chew bubblegum and say no more than eighteen words ... and I'm all out of}}
comics.alt: I came here to chew bubblegum and say no more than eighteen words ... and I'm all out of
comics.title: Bubblegum

comics.alt: The tumbleweed then tried to roll off into the sunset, but due to the Old West's placement north of the subtropical ridge, the prevailing winds were in the wrong direction.
comics.title: Showdown

comics.alt: fMRI testing showed that subjects who don't agree to participate are much more likely to escape from the machine mid-scan.
